item.title: Starfield Player is Unable to Loot a Dung Pile Due to a Hilarious Glitch
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Starfield player found a locked dung pile due to glitch - just one of many hilarious bugs in the game.
  • Funnily enough, the player didn't have any lockpicks, meaning that they weren't able to see what was in the dung pile.
  • Bethesda faces challenges fixing glitches in Starfield since it's such a massive game, so it remains to be seen if locked dung piles will remain a problem.

A Starfield player has discovered a locked pile of dung in the game due to a hilarious glitch. While Starfield was one of Bethesda’s most bug-free releases, it’s still a massive game that is prone to weird glitches, and this bug is certainly among the most hilarious ones a gamer can run into.

Starfield was Microsoft’s biggest first-party release in 2023. Despite being available on Game Pass, Starfield became a best-seller on Steam , partly due to being widely praised soon after its release. However, as time passed, many players discovered all sorts of bugs in the space exploration game, ranging from game-breaking to funny glitches.

Related
Starfield Mod Adds Classic Star Wars Ship to the Game
A Starfield modder has brought a beloved ship from the Star Wars prequel trilogy to Bethesda's massive outer space science fiction RPG.

Now, a Starfield player called InitialPirate1359 discovered a hilarious glitch while exploring a planet in Starfield . They found a pile of monster dung, but could not open it due to it being locked, something that makes no sense considering this is a fully “natural-made” container. To unlock containers in Starfield , players need to use Digipicks, but InitialPirate1359 did not have any of these handy items, and was unable to obtain whatever was inside the dung pile. The bug likely happened because Starfield randomly generates some parts of the game, including what kinds of containers are locked or not. However, it seems that Bethesda did not foresee some of these locked containers being piles of alien monster dung.

Locked Dung Piles Are Only Some of Starfield's Many Bugs

Starfield has quite a few bugs, but at least most of them are somewhat harmless. For instance, a gamer saw a funny glitch when a ship landed in the water in Starfield earlier this year. The player looked inside the sunken ship and discovered all of its inhabitants trying to swim and hilariously failing at that, as Starfield does not have any actual swimming mechanics for NPCs.

Another curious glitch-related situation happened a few days ago when a player tried to take advantage of a weird Starfield bug while building an outpost . During the construction, one of the walls of the player’s outpost simply vanished into thin air. The player decided to use the opportunity to build a free-floating deck through the then inexistent wall. However, the gamer’s plan backfired when they left the game and loaded it again, as the missing wall had reappeared, blocking off their ingenious deck. Hopefully, Bethesda will keep supporting Starfield and getting rid of these glitches, but the game is enormous, so it’s likely that some of them will never be addressed.

item.title: Amazing Skyrim Painting Imagines Winterhold Before The Collapse
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Skyrim player's impressive painting of Winterhold envisions the city pre-collapse, expanding it with grand city walls.
  • The artwork, a mix of pen and watercolor, took two and a half weeks to complete, showcasing incredible attention to detail.
  • The Winterhold in Skyrim pales in comparison to the painting, inspiring players to imagine and create new versions with mods.

A talented Skyrim player has shared their impressive painting of Winterhold, which imagines what the city might have looked like prior to its collapse. Skyrim 's Winterhold leaves a lot to be desired when compared to some of the game's other cities, and this version would certainly make it one of the best areas in the game to explore.

Ever since Skyrim was first released back in 2011, the game has inspired a ton of amazing fan creations. Some players create mods for others to use in-game, expanding the Skyrim experience for the better. Others create items from the game in real life, bringing Skyrim into their own home in other ways. Just recently, one Skyrim player shared their impressive cross-stitch of the game's map , showing off the incredible level of talent among the community. It's so impressive that gamers remain so enamored with Skyrim almost 13 years after its original launch.

Related
Skyrim Glitch Makes Markarth River Disappear
A Skyrim player online finds an extremely unique bug, which causes the entire river in Markarth to seemingly disappear into thin air.

Redditor Dravidistan shared their amazing Winterhold painting, which massively expands the city with grand city walls, giving it a much larger appearance than what is seen in the game. Skyrim 's College of Winterhold still towers above the city as before, but it's no longer the only attraction. According to the user, the artwork is an amazing mix of pen and watercolor paints, taking around two and a half weeks to complete in total. While this might seem like a long time, the attention to detail shines through in the final piece, with each brick in the city painstakingly hand-drawn by Dravidistan.

Awesome Skyrim Winterhold Painting

The Winterhold that players see in Skyrim is clearly a shadow of its former self, with a ton of ruined buildings still littering the city. Wondering what it might look like is only natural, and there are even plenty of amazing Skyrim mods that restore it to its former glory. As a matter of fact, Dravidistan mentions in the thread that the artwork "was inspired by all the restored Winterhold mods." It's awesome to see various fan creations inspiring one another to create something new, yet equally great in their own regard.

Although gamers remain captivated by Skyrim 's world, it will be interesting to see where Bethesda decides is the right location for the next Elder Scrolls game. Considering The Elder Scrolls 6 is in a playable state , this decision has already been made, although the developer has yet to reveal it to players. Right now, gamers will have to be a little more patient with Bethesda regarding The Elder Scrolls 6 , which, admittedly, is a big ask after almost 13 years of waiting. Hopefully, the studio will be able to reveal more about what it has in the works for the next Elder Scrolls title soon enough.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks Free Event Weapon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Version 4.7 of Genshin Impact will feature a free four-star weapon, Cloudwearer, for players to claim through an event.
  • New characters like Clorinde, Sigewinne, and Sethos will be introduced with unique elemental abilities to enhance gameplay.
  • Changes in the upcoming update include adding five-star weapons, altering Spiral Abyss rewards, and introducing a new domain for players to explore.

As per a new leak, Genshin Impact will give away a free four-star weapon in version 4.7. Although Genshin Impact is in the early stages of version 4.6 , a series of leaks regarding 4.7 have recently appeared online. The upcoming update will allegedly add a pair of five-star weapons and artifacts players can use to improve their character builds. In addition, it will reportedly change Spiral Abyss rewards to make the endgame mode more attractive.

Genshin Impact recently confirmed Clorinde, Sigewinne, and Sethos as version 4.7 characters that will be available on temporary banners. Players know little about these units, except the fact that Clorinde and Sigewinne specialize in Electro and Hydro elements, respectively. Like characters in version 4.6, they will appear in different parts of the update. The good news is that players will allegedly get one of their signature weapons for free.

Related
Genshin Impact Leak Reveals Special Mechanic for Sigewinne's Elemental Skill
Recent Genshin Impact leaks are showcasing a special mechanic used by upcoming Version 4.7 character Sigewinne for her Elemental Skill.

A recent Genshin Impact leak from FouL suggested that a four-star bow, Cloudwearer, will be free to claim in version 4.7. This new bow will reportedly be a signature weapon for Sethos, one of the upcoming Electro characters. If the leak is accurate, players will obtain Cloudwearer by completing a version 4.7 event, which could reportedly be Record of Reflective Writing, Endless Forms Most Material, Spino Doubleblaster, or Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation.

Genshin Impact Version 4.7 Free Weapon

  • Name: Cloudwearer
  • Type: Bow
  • Rarity: Four-star
  • Base ATK: 510
  • Elemental Mastery: 165

According to its description, Cloudwearer has a 510 base ATK and a 165 elemental mastery, which is fairly good for a four-star weapon. In addition to these stats, the upcoming bow has a passive ability that gives the wearer 48 elemental mastery for 10 seconds.

If this wooden bow is for Sethos, it could be released in the second phase of Genshin Impact version 4.7 , when the Electro character will allegedly make his introduction. There is also a likelihood that both Sethos and Cloudwearer will be available in the first phase of the update.

Genshin Impact 's Sethos is reportedly an Electro user who performs consecutive shots with a bow. He fires off arrows carrying the power of lightning and dealing increased damage. Using his plunging attack, the four-star DPS unit dishes out AoE damage and takes down multiple enemies at once.

Aside from characters and weapons, Genshin Impact will bring an alternative version of the Spiral Abyss , which is composed of eight floors. It will be a permanent domain where players take on a formidable roster of enemies to get at least 600 Primogems. Unlike the classic Spiral Abyss, the upcoming mode will allegedly feature only one chamber.

item.title: Mass Effect 3 Player Points Out Unsettling Ending Detail
item.description:
Highlights

  • A player noticed a strange detail in the ending of Mass Effect 3 involving a shrunken-down adult model.
  • Many players didn't notice this detail, possibly explaining why BioWare used it.

An eagle-eyed gamer has noticed an unsettling detail about the ending of Mass Effect 3 that would be easily missed by most players. The Mass Effect trilogy is packed full of interesting details, but this is one that BioWare perhaps wishes most players wouldn't discover.

Upon the release of Mass Effect 3 in 2012, the game's ending proved massively controversial. After three games of build-up and promises from developer BioWare, many felt it didn't live up to the lofty expectations. With time healing all wounds, it's easier to accept the ending of Mass Effect 3 nowadays, but at the time, it was mayhem in the game's community. BioWare even had to release an Extended Cut DLC to expand upon the original endings, and while this helped, it wasn't enough to fully satisfy all players. It's a fascinating situation to look back on over a decade later, especially with no direct sequel released as of yet.

Related
Mass Effect 4 Connecting to the OG Trilogy May Always Be Divisive
Mass Effect 4 would be coming hot off the heels of a beloved gaming story, and that might provide unexpected challenges for its story.

Redditor 87SIXSIXSIX5432ONE pointed out the bizarre detail, which occurs in the final scene of the game. While the grandfather is explaining the story of "the Shepard" to his grandson, the young child is actually a shrunken-down adult model, resulting in some extremely strange proportions. This could be waved away as a time-saving measure, in which case this would make a lot of sense. However, Mass Effect 3 has a child character and the Catalyst, both of which use the same model, so it's bizarre that this wasn't reused in the name of proper proportions. This strange detail doesn't change the fact that Mass Effect 3 remains one of the best sci-fi RPGs ever made, but it's no doubt an odd choice.

Mass Effect 3 Unsettling Ending Detail

Many in the thread pointed out that they didn't actually notice the detail until it was directly told to them, and this could explain BioWare's choice to use it in the first place. It's not a big deal if most players simply miss it, but it's certainly one of those things that's difficult to unsee for subsequent Mass Effect 3 playthroughs. Overall, the Mass Effect series is generally considered to be among the RPGs that encourage multiple playthroughs , so gamers should look out for this detail next time around.

After over a decade, it seems that Mass Effect 3 may finally be getting a direct sequel. Mass Effect: Andromeda was an interesting side adventure, but all signs point to the next game in the series finally carrying on the story that finished in 2012. The most recent teaser for the game was released on N7 Day in 2023, but there has been radio silence since that day. Although popular companion Liara is confirmed to return, it remains to be seen if the next Mass Effect will also be a continuation of Commander Shepard's story. Just recently, voice actress Jennifer Hale confirmed she hasn't been contacted for Mass Effect 4 , so if Shepard is returning, nobody at BioWare has made their voice actors aware yet.

item.title: Artist Designs Amazing Weapons Inspired by Pokemon Like Haunter and Dusknoir
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Pokemon fan artist named KosukeSukeP shares a stunning collection of weapons inspired by various Pokemon creatures, showcasing both their creativity and talent.
  • KosukeSukeP’s collection features 22 weapons based on creatures like Nincada, Grovyle, Dunskull, Gengar, Reshiram, and more.
  • Fans can look forward to new Pokemon Legends Z-A for the Switch, building on the success of Pokemon Legends: Arceus and likely inspiring even more fan art creations.

A Pokemon fan with excellent artistic skills has recently created a collection of weapons inspired by different Pokemon. The Pokemon community is well-known for the high quality of its fan art, and while works such as turning Pokemon into weapons are somewhat rare, they’re just as interesting as more popular expressions such as Paradox forms and regional variants.

The first Pokemon games appeared in 1996, and the franchise has seen massive success since then. With over 120 games released so far, Pokemon is one of the largest gaming franchises. The brand is widely successful even outside of gaming, though, due to having an official TV show, a trading card game, a collection of apparel, plushes, and much more. Recently, Pokemon Legends Z-A has been announced for the Switch as the sequel to the critically acclaimed Pokemon Legends: Arceus , and the upcoming title will probably be successful, likely spawning even more fan art.

Related
Pokemon Fan Creates Fusion Art of Vaporeon and Blacephalon
A talented fan artist creates a new Pokemon by imagining a fusion of the Water-type Vaporeon with the Fire/Ghost-type Blacephalon.

Now, a prolific Pokemon fan artist named KosukeSukeP has shared their latest artwork: an amazing collection of Pokemon-inspired weapons. KosukeSukeP’s collection features 22 weapons inspired by different creatures, including Nincada, Shedinja, Treecko, Grovyle, Dunskull, Dusknoir, Celebi, Sneasel, Hisui, Gengar, Reshiram, and others. The weapon types include scythes, sickles, katanas, daggers, swords, hammers, claws, fans, and even glaives. Some of the most cool-looking weapons devised by KosukeSukeP include a greatsword inspired by Dusknoir, which uses the colors and shapes of the Pokemon to create a gigantic blade, and a Haunter-inspired scythe, which has the face of the Ghost-type creature on its edge.

Pokemon-Inspired Weapon Designs Fan Art

This is not the first time that KosukeSukeP has created a collection of Pokemon -inspired weapons . Last month, the fan shared a batch of fan-made weapons such as a Lunatone staff, a Solrock rapier, a Xatu Spear, an Onix Hammer, a Greavard Sword, and others.

KosukeSukeP has been devising these stylish weapons inspired by Pokemon since at least 2023. In previous collections, the artist designed unique pieces such as an amazing Skarmory-inspired sword and shield that was clearly based on Link’s weapons in the Zelda franchise, for example.

Pokemon fan art is pretty varied, and while this specific artist works by turning Pokemon into weapons, others prefer to create alternative forms for classic creatures. For instance, a Pokemon fan created a pseudo-legendary evolution for Seadra called Poseidra earlier this month. This new Water/Dragon-type Pokemon was a lot like Kingdra, but had stronger draconic aspects than its official counterpart.
